context: 19-21 Furthermore, exposure to antibiotics and acid suppression alters antral inflammation and the intragastric distribution of the bacterium. 22,23 Availability may also be limited by cost of endoscopy and histologic interpretation. 24 Gastric urease activity is a surrogate marker for the presence of H. pylori. Detection of this activity forms the basis of the rapid urease tests (CLO test, Pylori Tek test, Hp Fast) and radiolabeled carbon (13C, 14C) urea breath tests. The urea-gel test is a qualitative analysis of the urease activity in a small sample of gastric mucosa, i.e., a test of focal gastric urease activity. On the other hand, the [13C]urea breath test quantitatively measures the urease activity in a larger portion of the stomach and is considered a global test. In our study, the sensitivity, specificity, and positive and negative predictive values for the urea-membrane test at 1 hour were 98.0%, 93.9%, and 94.2% and 97.9%, respectively.
